page.title: 08Warkton Church, Kettering.
page.content: Unlike many of the Northamptonshire churches St. Edmund's Church, Warkton has a tower rather than a spire. The church dominates the village rising majestically above the surrounding stone cottages. Since its Norman and Gothic origins the church has been restored twice. Inside there are 18th.and 19th. century monuments to the Montagu family of Boughton House. Two of them are by the rococo sculptor Louis Roubiliac and are set in apses and decorated with many cherubs and urns. Some local people feel that the church should be associated with Weekley rather than being part of the Barton Seagrave group of churches Others feel sad that the 5 bells are seldom rung except by visitors who have rung many peals.
